intro: Quercus jinpinensis, commonly known as the Jinpin oak, is a species of deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall and its production of acorns. It typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in temperate climates. The botanical features of Quercus jinpinensis make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
